Package calculators

Class CalculatorAdvanced

java.lang.Object
calculators.Calculator
calculators.CalculatorAdvanced
public class CalculatorAdvanced extends Calculator
This class extends class Calculator. This class provides more features than the Calculator class.

  • Method Details

    • calculateAdvanced

      public void calculateAdvanced(char action) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      This method works differently depending on the paremeter. If the parameter is a digit then we calculate the power of the number. If the parameter is ! then we calculate the factorial.
      Parameters:
      action - This is the only parameter.This parameter could be a digit or !.
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - This method throws this exception when operation is invalid.
      NumberNotInAreaException - This method throws this exception when the currentValue is not greater then 10 or lower than 0.

    • hasCharacteristic

      public Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value) throws NumberNotInAreaException, NotSupportedOperationException
      This method works differently depending on the paremeter. If the value of the parameter is 'A', then we calculate whether curentvalue is amstrong's number. If the value of the parameter is 'P', then we calculate whether curentvalue is a perfect number.
      Parameters:
      value - This is the only parameter.Its value should be 'A' or 'P'.
      Returns:
      Method return true when the currentValue is perfect number or amstrong's number.
      Throws:
      NumberNotInAreaException - This method throws this exception when the currentValue is less then 1.
      NotSupportedOperationException - This method throws this exception when the currentValue is less then 1.

    • factorialFuncion

      public Double factorialFuncion()
      This method calculates the factorial of a number and has no parameters.
      Returns:
      Method returns the factorial of the currentValue.

    • isValidOperation

      public boolean isValidOperation(char action)
      This method is called in calculateAdvanced method and its task is to check whether parameter is valid. If the parameter is a number in the range 0 to 10 or the character !, then it si valid.
      Parameters:
      action - This is the parameter we check.
      Returns:
      This method returns true value if the parameter is valid otherwise returns a false value.

    • isPerfectNumber

      public boolean isPerfectNumber(int number)
      This method calculates whether a number is a perfect number.
      Parameters:
      number - This is the only parameter.
      Returns:
      This method returns a true value if the number is a perfect number.

    • isArmstrongNumber

      public boolean isArmstrongNumber(int number)
      This method calculates whether a number is an amstrong number.
      Parameters:
      number - This is the only parameter.
      Returns:
      This method returns a true value if the number is a perfect number.
